intro: Vulpiella tenuis, commonly known as the slender foxglove, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its nectar-rich blossoms. Vulpiella tenuis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
